titlestmt.titleproper: Madeline Howland collection of Welcome Society applications 1965-1994
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Madeline Howland collection of Welcome Society applications
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Madeline Howland was a researcher for the Welcome Society of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of documentation related to applications to the Welcome Society. The bulk of the collection is candidate's working sheets and applications. These documents list arrival ship, arrival date, and information on various generations of their family, beginning with the candidate and working backwards. There is some correspondence related to the applications. The collection also includes miscellaneous genealogical research on various families, such as photocopies from printed sources, datasheets, and handwritten notes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
